wikipedia_page.main: Dame Caroline Elizabeth Wilson  (born 12 August 1970) is a British diplomat and lawyer who assumed office as the British Ambassador to China in September 2020.

response: * Caroline Wilson (diplomat), British Ambassador to China

link_mentions.page: List of University of Cambridge people
response: * Caroline Wilson (Downing), UK Ambassador to China (2020-)

Julia Caroline Wilson (born 7 June 1960) is an Australian sports journalist.  She is a football columnist for Melbourne's The Age newspaper, and also appears on 3AW's pre-match AFL discussion, is a panellist on Nine Network's Footy Classified, and an occasional panellist on the ABC program Offsiders.

Wilson began covering football in 1982. She has covered numerous sports, but specialises in the AFL (Australian Football League), and was chief football writer for The Age from 1999 to 2017. Wilson was the first woman to cover Australian Rules football full-time."Top 50 Sports People - Caroline Wilson", The Australian, 2013. Retrieved 5 October 2013."Age Profile - Caroline Wilson", The Age, 5 October 2013. Retrieved 5 October 2013.

link_mentions.page: List of ambassadors of the United Kingdom to China
response: The UK recognized the People's Republic of China in 1950, although the PRC did not agree to the exchange of ambassadors until 1972. Prior to this, the United Kingdom had sent ministers to the Qing Empire and variously ministers and ambassadors to the Republic of China. The Embassy offices have been located in Peking (Beijing), Nanking (Nanjing), or both. Currently the British Ambassador to China is Caroline Wilson, she became ambassador in September 2020.

link_mentions.page: List of people with surname Wilson
List of Honorary Fellows of Downing College, Cambridge

response: In February 2015 she was appointed British Ambassador to China, the first woman to hold the position. She was succeeded in September 2020 by Caroline Wilson.

link_mentions.page: Embassy of the United Kingdom, Beijing
response: The Embassy of the United Kingdom in Beijing (or British Embassy, Beijing) is the chief diplomatic mission of the United Kingdom in the People's Republic of China. It is one of Britain's largest overseas embassies. It is located at 11 Guang Hua Lu, in the Chaoyang District. The current British Ambassador to China is Caroline Wilson.
* Caroline Wilson (diplomat) (1970–), British diplomat and lawyer
* Caroline Fry (1787–1846), also known as Mrs Caroline Wilson, British writer
* Caroline Wilson, CMG, HM Ambassador, Beijing, China and former Director Europe, Foreign and Commonwealth Office. For services to British foreign policy.
